Nouse Editorial

Admin in the dock over mumps, Su on the ropes over the BNP, and a fond farewell to nouse veterans.

Why the government won't listen

Letters

Please send your comments and complaints to letters@nouse.co.uk or by mail to: nouse, Grimston House, Vanbrugh College, University of York.

Your:Platform

If Kilroy wants to air his narrow-minded views then it is his right

To a community of daytime TV loving students, the sudden withdrawal of the Kilroy show came as something of a shock to the system.

Where to spend?

While nobody could fault the university's high aims for expansion and progress - we have already been named the University of the Year - the current housing crisis show that maybe York should be reassessing its priorities.

Dire Democracy

E-democracy as a principle is a superb one but wll it work in reality?

PS21,875 for a degree that will be tomorrow's fish and chip paper

Downing Street, or (more likely) will be thanking his proverbial stars, that yet again he has pushed his Premiership to its limit and escaped the jaws of political suicide.

Letters

^html^Please send your comments and complaints to <a href="mailto:letters@nouse.co.uk">letters@nouse.co.uk</a> or by mail to nouse, Grimston House, Vanbrugh College.

Your:Platform

Enough of what our writers and editors have to say, we sent out some reporters to find out what you, the students, think about the issues of the moment...

No Frills GradBall? No thank you.

Dan Simon made over PS93,000 on ticket sales, why is Chris Osborne trying to con us into thinking only PS55,000 can be raised tis year?

Students on the frontline of York crime

Editorial Comment

New Chancellor, Media Censorship, Gradball and Crime...

Don't make me cough...

A bar without smoking is about as much fun as a bar without booze.

Letters

Please send your comments and complaints to letters@nouse.co.uk or by mail to nouse, Grimston House, Vanbrugh College.

Your:Platform

March If You Must

In the aftermath of the subsidised holiday trip to London to protest about top-up fees, it seems to me that students are all too keen to jump and shout without reflection. We appear to be blind to the fact that protesting simply does not work.

Scrap tuition fees. No small print.

Much to the surprise of almost every left wing Students' Union officer in the country, last term the Conservatives unveiled one of the first cornerstone policies of their new "Fair deal for all" campaign - to scrap all university tuition fees.

UGM's aren't working (again)

Chris Jones, the SU President, opened the first UGM last week with, what will no doubt, go down in UGM history: "Can I have some quiet please, this is difficult for me".

Fleeting Legacies

To most students currently at York the name Rod Hills may not mean much, but to most members of staff, and 3rd years, the name can't help but stir up memories.
